intro: Perityle tenella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved perityle, is a small herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight waxy coating. Perityle tenella produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color.
